Address: 302 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Sleek seafood venue that adopts a lounge aura with cocktails, music & dimmed lights after 9 PM.

summary.snippet: "Cozy atmosphere, excellent service and good food at a reasonable price."
"We enjoyed the outdoor dining, cocktails and quality of surf and turf."
"Limited menu - for a seafood restaurant no crab or lobster on the menu."

most_relevant.description:
The Black Pearl in Ann Arbor is a hidden gem on Main Street that's a perfect blend of relaxed vibes with an upscale twist. Known especially for their fish tacos, the seafood options are consistently fresh and expertly done.  We had a group gathering in their private room on Halloween.

There's an option to sit indoors or on the patio, and live music kicks in after 9:00 p.m., which adds to the lively ambiance. They’re open later on weekends, so it’s a great spot to wind down or keep the night going. Call ahead or book online, especially if you’re going during prime hours.

I ate at the Black Pearl with my family. It was a wonderful experience. The staff were the most  friendly and attentive I've ever encountered! The atmosphere was cool and fun.  I liked the outdoor seating arrangement.

The food was phenomenal:
My dad ordered the weekly special, which was the hangar wagyu steak. He shared a bite with me, and it was out of this world! I think he was quiet most of the meal because he was so absorbed in the flavor of the steak.
My mom ordered the salmon, and she was very happy with it. The salsa sauce complimented it really well. I also think it was the most beautifully presented.
I enjoyed the red snapper!  The quinoa was also very flavorful and rich. I don't know how they did that because I usually find quinoa bland and dry. The plantains were another showstopping highlight. They were absolutely perfect. Crispy caramelized outside, melt in your mouth inside. They were flavorful, just the right level of sweetness, and not at all starchy.

We were very pleased with our experience here. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, especially if you have a special occasion.

Atmosphere was amazing. We got
To sit in the patio area. Burger was amazing. Sushi was ok. I felt it needed a little more flavor.

This place slightly looks like a dive bar, but the menu is AMAZING. I had the crab rangoon dip which was very good,  but the scallops. MY GOD. The best scallops I have likely ever had. The bartender said they do variations of it menu to menu, so I'm excited to grab these again soon! This place is a must.

Delicious! Friendly staff, love the outdoor patio in the seating. Never disappointed with the food, been here a couple times and it’s consistently been amazing. Photos shows the Beet Salad (one of the best salads I’ve ever had!) and the Surf and Turf Pasta, and the Mano Keylime and Chocolate Mousse Cake.

Excellent food!! We placed carry out order, everything was delicious. Next time we will dine in for sure. Seafood rolls and salmon cakes were fresh and super tasty but the brussel sprouts omg!! They're a must try, have had at many different restaurants but not like this.

The black pearl on a summer night is the best. Nice breeze, music and some cocktails. The service is outstanding! They changed up the menu and I absolutely love it. The salmon was spicy but so good. I also had the seasonal salad and the unique combination  of mango with peppers, pomegranate seeds and almonds was so yummy and freshening. In addition to the food and great service the drinks are hands down my favorite. The last straw-berry is a perfect blend of tart with a kiss of sweetness. I also tried the new strawberry crème brûlée had more of a yogurt consistency but still good.

More of a bar environment. Even though we were seated in the dining area it was extremely loud. Our waiter was super cool and attentive. The Crab Rangoon dip was AMAZING! The wontons were fresh but I wish they came out warm. But so good. We split the surf and turf pasta and OMG I would get that time and time again.
